_header: After that harvest Inned had his sheaves
_description: Thomas Hoccleve, ‘Complaint,’ first of several works in verse and prose that form Hoccleve’s Series, followed by 508 — fifty-nine stanzas rhyme royal. For the full series, see 508, 2621, 4879, and 5663.

BodLauMis735.First Lines:
Affter þat hervest ynned had his shevesAnd þat þe
                    bronne sesoun of mighelmes…
BodLauMis735.Last Lines:
…ffor thi ȝestys and þi benefices allAnd vn to
                    þi mercy and grace I call

BodSelSup53.First Lines:
Aftir tat heruest Inned had hise sheuesAnd that the groun sesoun of
                    Mihelmesse…
BodSelSup53.Last Lines:
…And thi ȝistis and benefices alleAnd vn to thi mercy and
                    grace I calle
BodSelSup53.Editions:
Gray,  Douglas. 
             The Oxford Book of Late Medieval Verse and Prose.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1985: 56-8.

Bod221.First Lines:
After þat herveste ynned had his schevesAnd þat þe
                    broune sesoun of unghelmesse…
Bod221.Last Lines:
…ffor þi ȝeftis and thy benefaces allAnd vnto thy
                    mercy and grace I call
Bod221.Attributed Title:
Here endith my complaynte and begynnes a dialogg (f.
                    6v)

CovAcc3251.First Lines:
Affter þe hevest ynned had his shevesAnd þat the brome
                    sesoun of myghelmasse…
CovAcc3251.Last Lines:
…ffor thy yifftis and thi benefites allAnd vn to þi
                    mercie and grace I call
CovAcc3251.Attributed Title:
Incipit prologus de Incendio Amoris (f. 40rb); hic
                        finit questus siue planctus Thome Occleue (f. 43rb)

DULCosViii9.First Lines:
After that hervest Inned had his shevesand that the brome season of
                    myhelmesse…
DULCosViii9.Last Lines:
…for thy giftes and benefices allAnd vnto thy mercye and grace
                    I sall
DULCosViii9.Facsimiles:
Burrow,  John,  and  A. I. Doyle, eds.  
             Thomas Hoccleve: A Facsimile of the Autograph Verse
                Manuscripts.
EETS
         s.s. 19 (2002).
DULCosViii9.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.   Hoccleve’s Works: The Minor Poems. vol. 1.  EETS
         e.s. 61 (1892); repr. with Gollancz (1925)
XGollancz,  Israel. 
             Hoccleve’s Works: The Minor Poems. vol. 2.  EETS

YaleBei493.First Lines:
Affter þat Hervest ynned Had His shevesAnd þat þe
                    broune sesoun of Mighelmesse…
YaleBei493.Last Lines:
…ffor thy ȝefftys and thy benefices allAnd vn to thy
                    mercy and grace I call
YaleBei493.Attributed Title:
Here endith my compleynt and begynneth a dialogg (f.
                    6v)
